intro: Doronicum rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaf leopard's bane, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a compact, bushy growth habit with hairy, dark green leaves that are round or oval in shape. Its flowers are typically yellow with a distinctive purple or brown central disk, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
